findings.author: MatthewBerman
findings.text: @OpenRouterAI @openclaw Does open router work better than the built in router?

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @OllieFGrant Open-source local full agent workflows is a powerful combo. It turns claude code from a tool you try into infrastructure you can actually rely on.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @DBVolkov This is useful because landing pages are usually a thinking problem, not a tooling problem. AI just compresses the feedback loop between idea and execution.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @aibymatt This aligns with a first-principles mindset I really admire.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ArjunPatelAI Libraries like this help people move from experimentation to execution fast.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text:
@jasminejpark Every major platform shift came when abstractions got simpler. 

Skills feel like the abstraction layer that could make agents mainstream, similar to how APIs unlocked the web.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @TobyReinhar The long term perspective here explains why some breakthroughs feel inevitable in hindsight.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @OllieFGrant This makes ai feel practical and immediately useful, not abstract.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @aibymatt Everyone says they‚Äôre patient until the silence kicks in and the anxiety starts talking.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ArjunPatelAI Acting like the kind of person you want to be comes before feeling like them.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @DBVolkov You can see how context changes which law applies, instead of treating them like commandments.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ericpwang Early personal computers were dismissed as toys compared to mainframes, until local compute became good enough to unlock entirely new use cases.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @EvanWhitak Complexity doesn‚Äôt disappear, it just changes shape.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @andreaskellers What‚Äôs different now is AI reasoning about intent and structure, not just translating code. In the future, platform boundaries may matter far less.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text:
This guy literally drops a free 90-minute masterclass on turning AI into your personal software engineer
https://t.co/uBXciWucZ4

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @yulintwt Having followed Khosla‚Äôs predictions for years, seeing him discuss AI themes alongside Rabois provides such a clear roadmap for where the next decade of infrastructure is heading.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @aibymatt Fun tools deep theory is a great combo. Learning sticks much better when exploration is encouraged.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ArjunPatelAI This explains why experienced engineers seem to be accelerating, not slowing down, with AI.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text:
@TobyReinhar Love how this makes people actually test themselves instead of just consuming advice. 

Interactive experiments like this stick way more than abstract tips about productivity.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @TobyReinhar Prompt engineering feels like the early days of programming, simple today, foundational for how future tools will be built.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ericpwang This way of thinking feels very aligned with modern problem solving, where no domain exists in isolation anymore.

findings.author: milesdeutscher
findings.text:
You'll win big in 2026 if you barbell your free time:

80%: AI/using it to build a business
20%: Financial markets - investing cash flow/using AI to optimise

You could literally just send a GET request to /rest/v1/
